title: Directs the department of health to establish a certificate of recognition of stillbirth
summary: Directs the department of health establish a certificate of recognition of stillbirth; provides such form shall be given to the parents of a stillborn child; makes related provisions.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3453

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. GABRYSZAK, CALHOUN, MARKEY, SCHROEDER, SPANO,
         COOK, GOTTFRIED, P. LOPEZ, TOWNS,  MAYERSOHN,  CUSICK,  FINCH,  GALEF,
         GIGLIO,  GUNTHER,  McDONOUGH,  McKEVITT,  MOLINARO,  BARRON, ROBINSON,
         CAMARA, MENG, CRESPO, ZEBROWSKI, ORTIZ, CASTRO, SCARBOROUGH,  KAVANAGH
         --  Multi-Sponsored  by -- M. of A. ABBATE, AMEDORE, BARCLAY, BOYLAND,
         BOYLE, BROOK-KRASNY, BURLING, BUTLER, CASTELLI, COLTON, CONTE, CORWIN,
         CROUCH, CYMBROWITZ,  DINOWITZ,  DUPREY,  FITZPATRICK,  GIBSON,  HAYES,
         JEFFRIES, JORDAN, KOLB, LATIMER, LAVINE, LENTOL, MAGEE, McENENY, MILL-
         MAN,  MONTESANO,  OAKS, PERRY, PHEFFER, RABBITT, RAIA, RAMOS, REILICH,
         REILLY, SALADINO, SAYWARD, SWEENEY, TEDISCO, THIELE, TITONE,  TOBACCO,
         WEISENBERG -- read once and referred to the Committee on Health

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the public health law, in relation to establishing a
         certificate of recognition of stillbirth

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Subdivision 3 of section 4160 of the public health law, as
    2  amended by chapter 436 of the laws  of  1967,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    3. For the purposes of this article, a fetal death shall be considered
    5  as a birth and as a death except that, for a fetal death, separate birth
    6  and  death  certificates  shall  not  be  required  to  be  prepared and
    7  recorded, EXCEPT AS PROVIDED IN SECTION  FORTY-ONE  HUNDRED  SIXTY-A  OF
    8  THIS TITLE.
    9    S  2.  The public health law is amended by adding a new section 4160-a
   10  to read as follows:
   11    S 4160-A. CERTIFICATE OF RECOGNITION OF STILLBIRTH. 1. THE  DEPARTMENT
   12  SHALL  ESTABLISH A CERTIFICATE OF RECOGNITION OF STILLBIRTH. THE REGIST-
   13  RAR WITH WHOM A FETAL DEATH CERTIFICATE IS FILED SHALL ISSUE  A  CERTIF-
   14  ICATE  OF  RECOGNITION OF STILLBIRTH TO THE PARENT OR PARENTS NAMED ON A
   15  FETAL DEATH CERTIFICATE ISSUED IN THE CASE OF  A  STILLBIRTH,  UPON  THE
   16  REQUEST  OF  SUCH PARENT OR PARENTS. IF BOTH PARENTS ARE DECEASED AT THE

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02740-02-1

       A. 3453                             2

    1  TIME OF THE STILLBIRTH, THE REGISTRAR SHALL ISSUE  THE  CERTIFICATE  TO,
    2  AND  UPON  THE  REQUEST OF, THE SIBLING, PARENT, OR PARENTS OF THE BIRTH
    3  PARENTS.
    4    2.  A  CERTIFICATE  ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL INCLUDE SUCH
    5  APPROPRIATE INFORMATION AS SHALL BE DETERMINED  BY  THE  DEPARTMENT  AND
    6  SHALL  BE  ON  A FORM ESTABLISHED BY THE DEPARTMENT WHICH IS SIMILAR, AS
    7  APPLICABLE, TO THE FORM OF A CERTIFICATE PRESCRIBED BY SECTION FORTY-ONE
    8  HUNDRED THIRTY OF THIS ARTICLE RELATING TO A LIVE BIRTH.
    9    3. A PERSON WHO PREPARES A FETAL DEATH CERTIFICATE PURSUANT TO SECTION
   10  FORTY-ONE HUNDRED SIXTY OF THIS TITLE, OR THEIR DESIGNEE, SHALL  INFORM,
   11  IN  WRITING,  THE PARENT OR PARENTS OF A STILLBORN FETUS OF THE RIGHT TO
   12  RECEIVE A CERTIFICATE OF RECOGNITION OF  STILLBIRTH.  PROVIDED,  HOWEVER
   13  THAT  IF  BOTH PARENTS ARE DECEASED AT THE TIME OF SUCH STILLBIRTH, THEN
   14  THE PERSON SHALL SO INFORM THE SIBLING, PARENT OR PARENTS OF  THE  BIRTH
   15  PARENT OR PARENTS.
   16    4.  THE  PERSON  WHO  PREPARES  A CERTIFICATE PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION
   17  SHALL INCLUDE THEREON THE NAME GIVEN  TO  THE  STILLBORN  FETUS  BY  THE
   18  PARENTS,  IF  THE  PARENT  OR  PARENTS WISH TO INCLUDE SUCH NAME ON SUCH
   19  CERTIFICATE.
   20    5. A CERTIFICATE ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL NOT  CONSTITUTE
   21  PROOF  OF  A LIVE BIRTH. FURTHERMORE, SUCH CERTIFICATE SHALL NOT BE USED
   22  TO CALCULATE LIVE BIRTH STATISTICS.
   23    6. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS CHAPTER, THE PARENT  OR
   24  PARENTS  MAY  ELECT TO HAVE THE DISCLOSURE OF AND ACCESS TO THE INFORMA-
   25  TION INCLUDED ON SUCH CERTIFICATE LIMITED TO THE PARENTS  NAMED  ON  THE
   26  CERTIFICATE,  THEIR  LAWFUL  REPRESENTATIVES, TO AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL OF
   27  THE DEPARTMENT, AND TO THE REGISTRAR.
   28    7. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE TERM "STILLBIRTH" SHALL  MEAN
   29  THE UNINTENDED INTRAUTERINE DEATH OF A FETUS THAT OCCURS AFTER THE CLIN-
   30  ICAL ESTIMATE OF THE TWENTIETH WEEK OF GESTATION.
   31    8.  A  CERTIFICATE  OF  RECOGNITION OF STILLBIRTH MAY BE REQUESTED AND
   32  ISSUED REGARDLESS OF THE DATE ON WHICH THE FETAL DEATH  CERTIFICATE  WAS
   33  ISSUED.
   34    9.  THE  REGISTRAR  MAY CHARGE A FEE FOR THE ISSUANCE OF A CERTIFICATE
   35  UNDER THIS SECTION EQUAL TO THE FEE AUTHORIZED BY LAW  FOR  THE  CERTIF-
   36  ICATION OF A BIRTH OR DEATH.
   37    10.  THIS SECTION SHALL APPLY TO THE CITY OF NEW YORK, NOTWITHSTANDING
   38  SECTION FORTY-ONE HUNDRED FOUR OF THIS ARTICLE. FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS
   39  SECTION, IN RELATION TO THE CITY OF NEW YORK, THE TERM "REGISTRAR" SHALL
   40  MEAN THE OFFICIAL OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK WITH WHOM FETAL DEATH  CERTIF-
   41  ICATES ARE FILED.
   42    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   43  it  shall  have become a law, and shall apply to instances of stillbirth
   44  regardless of whether they occurred before or after the  effective  date
   45  of this act.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to establishing a certificate of recognition of stillbirth
